BiblioData.Title: FABRICATION OF MICROSTRUCTURES AND NANOSTRUCTURES USING ETCHING RESIST
BiblioData.Abstract: Nanostructures and microstructures are formed by patterning methods such as Dip Pen Nanolithography (DPN) or microcontact printing of organic molecules functioning as a resist on a substrate followed by an etching step. The etch resist is a patterning composition and can contain on a substrate including polyethylene glycol (PEG). Positive and negative etch methods can be used.

Claims.P: WHAT IS CLAIMED IS:

1. A method of forming nanostructures or microstrucrures comprising the steps of: performing direct- write nanolithography to pattern a surface of a substrate with a patterning composition comprising an oligomeric or polymeric compound and to provide an exposed substrate, wherein the patterning composition is physisorbed to the substrate surface; and etching the exposed substrate on the patterned surface to form the nanostructures or microstructures.
2. The method of claim 1 , wherein the patterning composition comprises a water soluble oligomeric or polymeric compound.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the oligomeric or polymeric compound comprises a heteroatom in the backbone.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the oligomeric or polymeric compound comprises an oxygen atom.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the patterning composition comprises polyethyleneglycol (PEG) or polyethylene oxide (PEO).
6. The method of claim 1, wherein the patterning composition comprises polypropylene glycol, wax, polyethylene imine, or a combination thereof.
7. The method of claim 1 , comprising the step of applying the patterning composition to a tip.
8. The method of claim 1 , wherein patterning a surface of a substrate comprises transfer of the patterning composition from a tip to the surface of the substrate.
9. The method of claim 8, wherein the tip is a scanning probe microscope tip.
10. The method of claim 8, wherein the tip is an atomic force microscope tip.
11. The method of claim 8, wherein the tip is a hollow tip.
12. The method of claim 8 wherein the tip is a non-hollow tip.
13. The method of claim 8, wherein patterning a surface of a substrate is carried out at a relative humidity of at least about 40%.

14. A method of forming nanostructures or microstructures comprising the steps of: performing microcontact printing to pattern the surface of a substrate with a patterning composition comprising an oligomeric or polymeric compound and to provide an exposed substrate, wherein the patterning composition is physisorbed to the substrate surface; and etching the exposed substrate on the patterned surface to form the nanostructures or microstructures.
15. The method of claim 14, wherein the patterning composition comprises a water soluble oligomeric or polymeric compound.
16. The method of claim 14, wherein the oligomeric or polymeric compound comprises a heteroatom in the backbone.
17. The method of claim 14, wherein the oligomeric or polymeric compound comprises an oxygen atom.
18. The method of claim 14, wherein the patterning composition comprises polyethyleneglycol (PEG) or polyethylene oxide (PEO).

19. A method of forming nanostructures or microstructures comprising the steps of: performing direct- write nanolithography to pattern a surface of a substrate with a patterning composition comprising an oligomeric or polymeric compound, wherein the patterning composition is physisorbed to the substrate surface; coating the non-patterned region of the substrate surface with a passivating compound; removing the patterning composition to provide exposed substrate; and etching the exposed substrate to form nanostructures or microstructures.
20. The method of claim 19, wherein the patterning composition comprises a water soluble oligomeric or polymeric compound.
21. The method of claim 19, wherein the oligomeric or polymeric compound comprises a heteroatom in the backbone.
22. The method of claim 19, wherein the oligomeric or polymeric compound comprises an oxygen atom.
23. The method of claim 19, wherein the patterning composition comprises polyethyleneglycol (PEG) or polyethylene oxide (PEO).
24. The method of claim 19, wherein the patterning composition comprises polypropylene glycol, wax, polyethylene imine or a combination thereof.
25. The method of claim 19, comprising the step of applying the patterning composition to a tip.
26. The method of claim 19, wherein patterning a surface of a substrate comprises transfer of the patterning composition from a tip to the surface of the substrate.
27. The method of claim 26, wherein the tip is a scanning probe microscope tip.
28. The method of claim 26, wherein the tip is an atomic force microscope tip.
29. The method of claim 26, wherein the tip is a hollow tip.
30. The method of claim 26 wherein the tip is a non-hollow tip.
31. The method of claim 26, wherein patterning a surface of a substrate is carried out at a relative humidity of at least about 40%.

32. A method of forming nanostructures or microstructures comprising the steps of: performing microcontact printing to pattern the surface of a substrate with a patterning composition comprising an oligomeric or polymeric compound; coating the non-patterned region the substrate surface with a passivating compound, wherein the patterning composition is physisorbed to the substrate surface; removing the patterning composition and provide exposed substrate; and etching the exposed substrate to form nanostructures or microstructures.
33. The method of claim 32, wherein the patterning composition comprises a water soluble oligomeric or polymeric compound.
34. The method of claim 32, wherein the oligomeric or polymeric compound comprises a heteroatom in the backbone.
35. The method of claim 32, wherein the oligomeric or polymeric compound comprises an oxygen atom.
36. The method of claim 32, wherein the patterning composition comprises polyethyleneglycol (PEG) or polyethylene oxide (PEO).

37. A method comprising: disposing an ink composition on a tip, wherein the ink composition comprises poly( ethylene glycol) or poly( ethylene oxide), transferring the ink composition to a substrate surface to form a deposit, exposing the substrate to etching conditions.
38. The method of claim 37, wherein transferring is carried out by scanning probe contact printing or dip pen nanolithography.
